Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: jnjdougan
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel ! I had fallen in the airport so was greatful that the big beautiful modern shower had lots of water pressure and hot water! We enjoyed the little room with the nice high ceilings. We walked to all the tourist sights as the hotel was perfectly located! The morning breakfast buffet was delicious and quite reasonable!

Reviews.Title: “quiet, modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lori A
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located across from Retiro Park and within walking distance of high-end shopping and most tourist attractions. Hotel offered Wi-Fi in all rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice modern hotel across from Retiro park”
Reviews.Author: RBNY65
Reviews.Content: This property is very nice for a quick getaway in Madrid. Every room has cool decor and there is a laptop for use which is super convenient. Breakfast was adequate. Only lacks a fitness room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: MrsSavani
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in the perfect spot! As other reviewers said, it's right across from the park and walking distance from all the museums. They even have breakfast included...which was your typical breakfast. The rooms were spectacular. There was a spa shower! The bed was also very comfortable, my husband and I accidentally slept till noon one day here because the room stayed nice and dark until you opened the curtains. (get a wake up call if you have to be up for something!) We even got our laundry done here because we were halfway through our trip, and although it was a bit expensive, they did a good job and got all of our clothes back to us the same day that we gave it to them. Overall, a great, modern hotel for a stay in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOSITY”
Reviews.Author: lezblowup
Reviews.Content: The perfect, sexy hotel. Across from the amazing Madrid Parque and walking distance from everything...fab shopping in Sol, the museums....restaurants, nightlife, metro. The staff was amazing, the rooms tres chic, the price....got the skyauction.com hookup so it was great. I would definitely stay here again! Any average or Very good rating was because I didn't experience them. I was too busy exploring the streets of Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: chris_ottokar
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights and found this hotel very comfortable and situated in a beautiful location near Retiro Park. The Prado Museum is about 10mins walk away and the surrounding neighbourhood is one of Madrid's finest! Staff were friendly and room service was impeccable. The nearest Metro stop is about 10-15mins walk. Had the hotel breakfast one morning (€15) which was good - though not stunning. For the price however I think it was fine. There was the usual selection of cereals, cold meats, cheeses, bread rolls and a few hot foods (scrambled eggs, bacon, etc..). The only drawback for me was the apparent lack of restaurants in the area - there were a couple around but it was a bit of a walk between them. It's more of a quiet area and not full of bars and eateries. Still, I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We booked this on the basis of its location, in the Art Triangle, and had a great stay. Directly opposite the Retiro Park the hotel is a beautiful building (Palace) that has been converted into a modern hotel. We stayed in room 001 which unfortunately does not have a view of the park, rather a building in the side road opposite, but no matter. The room was huge, more like a small conference room (with table and chairs to boot) and the en suite bathroom had a great shower. We did not eat the 15 euro each buffet breakfast but instead found a wonderful organic bakery 5 mins away. The staff were helpful but we were obviously tourists and this is a conference/business hotel so their focus seemed to be on the corporate guests. They did allow us to leave our bags with them for the afternoon after check out time, which was very helpful. Locally the restaurants are catering for the business community and wealthy chic so 100 euro each norm but there are literally hundreds of fantastic eateries if you head west about 15 mins by foot or jump on the Metro @ Retiro. All in all for 300 Euro for two nights including taxes and booking fees, we would go again but ask for a room overlooking the beautiful park.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Betsy B
Reviews.Content: We were here three nights having arrived from Washington. The hotel was very clean and we were given a quiet room. Slept well and loved the shower! The size of the room was manageable and typical of a room in a city. The location was fine and walkable, especially to the major three museums. Staff was very helpful and friendly. We definitely enjoyed our stay in Madrid and would recommend this hotel. It was disappointing not to be informed of any of the history of the building which was lovely. I suspect old politics have something to do with the lack of historical information....too bad.

Reviews.Title: “good location and decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: future2020
Reviews.Content: Hotel located in very nice area in front of the Park , i stayed for two weeks . room service was fast and helpful. there are many good restaurants around this area and coffee shops such as Ramses. but i am not sure about high tech as it has basic staff . internet is very with high speed

Reviews.Title: “Strange hotel, great park”
Reviews.Author: lindsay_williams
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in this hotel and worked all the next day in a hotel suite, eating breakfast and lunch. This is a strange hotel. It is a historic building which has been totally modernised and decked out in black and white: everything is either black or white. It is clean, comfortable with free wi-fi, and a laptop in the room. The huge park across the road is a definite plus. I arrived at 8pm and thought I might read in the bar if it was quiet. It was not so much quiet as morgue-like. There was no one there at all, including behind the bar. Reception said they would radio for a barman if I wanted! The room-service menu was very limited and hopeless for someone like me that can't eat bread. Breakfast was more than adequate with good service (although they don't know to make tea with boiling water). Lunch was delicious although we were the only ones in the restaurant. This was a good classy hotel and the staff were excellent but absolutely no atmosphere. I would not rush back. My client paid and I have no idea of the rate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Near Attractions”
Reviews.Author: BeaconTraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was chosen for us as it was a conference hotel. It is a beautiful historic building directly across from Retiro park. While the exterior has retained its historic look, the interior is completely modern. This conversion seems to have been pretty successful. The rooms are pretty standard hotel rooms with a nice small balcony that looks out over the street. The french doors were great for getting fresh air into the room. Storage in the room is somewhat limited as there is no closet or dresser, only a small wardrobe. A nice feature of the hotel is that the rooms have a laptop for your use. We got good wireless in our room, but they have a horrible wireless access policy. You have to physically visit the front desk to get the username and password for the day. The first day we got 24 hour access, the second day we got 3 day access. And this isn't access for the room, it is for each device. So if you have a second device (smart phone, iPad, etc.), you have to go to the front desk again for a password. It was quite annoying. Front desk staff was younger and seemed fairly inexperienced. The food and selections at the breakfast buffet are quite good. However, they are very understaffed. You first have to find a clean place to sit, and then the coffee service is quite slow. Fresh orange juice was very good as was the selection of fruit. Access to the park is wonderful, and the Prado is close by. But this hotel is quite removed from most activities in the city (Shopping, Plaza Mayor, etc.). Also, there are very limited dining options nearby. If you are looking for a good location close to the excitement that makes Madrid, this might not be the hotel for you. However, if you are looking for a hotel a little out of the way, quiet, and with access to some of Madrid's major attractions, this one might be for you.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for art lovers”
Reviews.Author: man727
Reviews.Content: It is a small and elegant hotel with great views of the Retiro Park, close to the museums and within walking distance to the Plaza Mayor. The room is designed for convenience and comfort; long work desk, plenty of room around the washing basin to place your toiletries, a small balcony, varied lighting option so that one is able to read.... I stayed there for 4 nights alone and enjoyed every minute. Most hotels in Spain do not equip with kettle, I bought a small coffee machine and made my own expresso in the middle of the night. Three words to conclude: Peaceful, Bright and Elegant.

Reviews.Title: “Under-rated hotel, close to everything, very clean and nice!”
Reviews.Author: Chicagoehc
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel and nicely situated near parks, botanic garden, Prado, etc. The rooms were big, shower powerful, excellent versatile lighting system, small balcony was useful to view park and know weather on 5th floor. Very attractive and very modern and free wifi (although wifi consistency was a bit irritating). Although our room overlooked the main road, the windows were well insulated. We could hear the baby in the next room, but only the dull sound of traffic. Loved the breakfast buffet - very fresh fruit and the bread/rolls/buns were very good. This is the second hotel I have been in this month with a frosted glass door to the bathroom - I hate this! At night when you/partner use the facilities the light from the bathroom lights up the rest of the room! Plus for those who are sharing rooms on business trips the privacy factor is annoying. That is my only complaint as the everything else was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good rooms”
Reviews.Author: ilovehuck
Reviews.Content: I had a second floor room with a French door that led out to a small balcony. There was some street noise - and the garbage men come around 2:00AM - but overall the room was peaceful. The bathroom is nice and has a really cool shower head (once you figure out how to use it). The bath products are scant - no conditioner or body lotion - and of average quality. The bed was comfortable and had a long body pillow. In your room, you only get heat or cool, depending on how they have set the master, which was a bit odd. I was there with colleagues who wanted to cool their room but they could not, as the master was only set to heat. It is in a great location, across from a huge park and about 5 min from the Puerto del Sol and 3 min (if that) from the Prado. The computer in the room is nice and the wireless is good. I thought breakfast had a lot of variety and the room service I ordered one night was quick, hot and tasty. I also had a good lunch there one day and the catering for our business meetings was quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Location”
Reviews.Author: roarythetiger
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located in the centre of Madrid. It is very clean, comfortable and nicely decorated. Some small changes could be made to make this a fantastic hotel though such as information in the room, you do get the use of a laptop in your room (which is a plus) but it does not show room service menus for any information for your hotel. A full length mirror would also be nice as the room only had one mirror in the bathroom above the sink. The main road outside the hotel is very noisy and it does not stop all through the night, but this is typical of busy cities and you do get used to it (ear-plugs may help). The breakfast was nice, lots of breads, cold meats (usual European breakfast) they do a small selection of hot food too, a nice Spanish omelette and bacon (scrambled eggs aren't good though). The staff are friendly enough and quite helpful when you ask them anything. Overall this is a nice hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: RHKRiodeJaneiro
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel build in an amazing building. Decor is a bit too modern, but room come with laptops and all white gadgets Recepcionist very kind, got the x15 apt - real marvel, just in front of Retiro's park. Amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel in nice location”
Reviews.Author: fr0764
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located opposite to the Retiro park, and within walking distance of the historical centre of Madrid. Helpful staff, well organized check in /out. The rooms have a modern look, are spacy and well isolated from street noise. Comfortable beds and nice bath room with a good shower. Breakfast buffet is OK, but the atmosphere in the room could be warmer. We also had to wait a bit too long for our coffee and thee. Good value for the price. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Martin H
Reviews.Content: Well placed next to Reitro Park. Rooms are very modern,slightly bizarre decor, but comfortable. Like the Laptop in the room to surf the net and decent flat screen TV. Good space and comfortable beds. Breakfast buffet is pretty good but not sure I would want to eat dinner there, its a bit gloomy. Not exactly cheap to stay here, I felt it was overpriced at 180 Euro a night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location near park but poor service for cost”
Reviews.Author: Solbaum
Reviews.Content: By the wonderful Retiro Park in Madrid and very modern room. Check in was understaffed and took one hour. Was not informed about any facilities by check in, e.g. later found out about bar, etc. Excuse was only open for 3 months. It was not that staff was uninformed, just not enough so no time to explain.

Reviews.Title: “underwhelming”
Reviews.Author: Anita W
Reviews.Content: This was the last hotel we stayed in at the end of a 2 week stay in spain. The hotel itself is quite a pretty building located opposite the Retiro Park.It is quite far from the Plaza Mayor and there aren't that many options for eating around the hotel. We had a park view room . I found the decor quite bizarre and not really keeping with the classic building. The room itself was spacious and clean,as was the bathroom. The staff were a bit odd. Not unfriendly but not friendly either. The service was probably the most lax of the 3 hotels we stayed in Spain. The breakfasts were not good, a waste of money . You are better off just going to a cafe nearby. I don't think i would stay here again . The next time I would just look for a hotel closer to the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Seasoned Traveler- worse hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: Alice N
Reviews.Content: The best sheets had stains on them. There is no sense of security. We had a break in at 4 am, called the front desk and there was no follow-up as to what happened. There are also no safety locks. The response in the morning was "nothing happened to you right, you're alive and didn't get raped, right?" We asked to inform and speak to the manager and the manager said they didn't want to talk to us. Naturally we wanted to cxl the remainder of our nights and they asked us to find our own wi fi to cancel it because we booked on line. Only when we became furious that there wifi was not working, the front desk finally cxled it on their computer. It was a simple task. We lost a whole nights of sleep because of the break and was rudely handled. We stayed at the Westin instead for not that much more and it was entirely a different experience there. We felt safe, clean and welcomed.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service”
Reviews.Author: Phoebe_ZC
Reviews.Content: My roommate told me her sheets has blood(red)stain on it. The location is a bit far west of center night life area (Plaza Mayor), but within 20m walking distance, and have a nice view of the park. I like it that it has pretty fast wifi, and a computer in the room. Front desk is generally helpful except when we reported that someone was trying to enter/break into our room at 4am. I was woken up thinking that someone was in our room, then hearing my roommate scream when the noise on the door got really loud. We called the front desk to ask them go check what's going on. Front desk said he is the only person in the hotel right now, but agree to check. We never heard any call back. Upon calling again, he said there is no problem any more. We changed our room to another floor at 5am. The next day, we ask to speak to the manager about this, the front desk staff was very dismissive, said the manager is not available, and this is not the hotel's problem, but problems of other guests. We insisted that the manager should be informed about this as a matter of hotel security, they went back spoke with her, came back to us said "the manager is too busy right now".

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location in Central Madrid”
Reviews.Author: TravelPhil
Reviews.Content: This is a modern (in fact, pretty much brand new) hotel in a beautiful historic building in the centre of Madrid located opposite the main park entrance. Very modern rooms with free WiFi and even a laptop provided. Very comfortable beds, huge walk-in showers, efficient and quiet air conditioning. Considered it excellent value for central Madrid at 160 euros/night. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints”
Reviews.Author: marcelbrazil
Reviews.Content: PPSA is a good hotel from a good chain. Location is great, People are friendly, etc. Adjustment rate because of lower-price guarantuee booking.com was not taken into the system but after showing communication it was altered without problems: good behaviour. For people looking for a middle-class, well priced alternative, this is a good choice. Of course a few things can be ugraded, like expanding the staff at the reception desk. To be recommended because of price-quality

Reviews.Title: “VERY POOR SERVICE!”
Reviews.Author: ISA B
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation in the hotel on line , i got my electronic mail confirming iI . Then unfortunately had some problems with may e mail and i lost this confirmation. I had to change my holiday days and i contact the hotel to make the changes as it was impossible to do it on line( you need the electronic mail ). Believe it or not , i have made many international telephone calls , sent many e mail they said they would but they did not. They are incapable to do it! Considering this is a simple task I imagine how awful this hotel should be!!!

Reviews.Title: “nice place, quiet place, good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: flavioedreira
Reviews.Content: good hotel, good stuff, avarage breakfest, cold atmosphere...

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel near Retiro Park”
Reviews.Author: kristineLA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Savoy Alfonso for 3 nights in a 4 person family room (king size bed + 2 bunk beds)(room 103). The hotel looks recently remodeled and has a space age-y feel. We didn't spend much time in the common areas or get the hotel breakfast so I can't speak to those. Our room was very spacious with high ceilings. It didn't have much of a view as it faced the back of other buildings, but that didn't matter much to us. This does affect how much light you get in the room in case that's a consideration for you. The beds were comfortable and we liked having the little individual lights by the bunk beds. They also had extra blankets in the cupboard which was helpful, as one of us liked to have the air conditioning on "high" whenever we were in the room. The air conditioning works really well. They also provide free wi-fi and a laptop in the room. The bathroom was a decent size and had the fanciest shower head. Considering it was so hot in Madrid that we were showering three times a day, I really appreciated it. As with the other Petit Palaces we stayed in, the bathroom door was clear glass with the center smoked out. Since the bathroom door faced away from the beds, the light from bathroom wasn't as intrusive, but I still think the bathroom doors are impractical. Maybe they could smoke out nearly the entire door to block the light yet maintain the modern look. The hotel is located right across the street from Retiro Park (which is absolutely lovely!). It's also particularly close to the Prado and within walking distance of the Reina Sofia and the Thyssen Bornemisza. Although it's close to these sites, it's actually in a quiet, residential neighborhood. There are several restaurants right along the same block and even more restaurants if you walk to Calle Serrano and Calle de Alcala (only a 5-10 min. walk). Overall, a nice modern hotel in a convenient location. I would stay there again or recommend it to my friends.

HotelInfo.Name: Petit Palace Savoy Alfonso XII Plus
HotelInfo.Address: Calle Alfonso XII 18, 28014 Madrid, Spain
